etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in American Journal of Science. From ancient Greek πινάκιον small tablet (from πινακ-, πίναξ + -ιον, diminutive suffix) + -lite, after German Pinakiolit

definitions: A mineral that is a borate of manganese and magnesium, Mg₂ MnO₂ (BO₃), occurring as tabular black crystals of a metallic appearance that belong to the monoclinic system.
